home.title: Yogyakarta Philosophical Axis Encyclopedia
home.subtitle: Exploring Javanese Cultural and Philosophical Heritage
home.featuredDescription: Explore various aspects of Yogyakarta's Philosophical Axis
home.description: The Philosophical Axis is an imaginary line stretching from south to north, connecting Parangtritis Beach, Yogyakarta Palace, and Mount Merapi. This line is not merely a geographical orientation, but a profound representation of Javanese philosophy about cosmological harmony.
home.description2: This concept reflects the relationship between humans (microcosm) and the universe (macrocosm), as well as the spiritual journey from worldly desires (Parangtritis) towards spiritual perfection (Merapi) with the Palace as the center of power and wisdom.
home.description3: This encyclopedia serves as a digital platform to document, promote, and preserve the rich cultural heritage along the Philosophical Axis corridor.
home.statisticsDescription: Explore the cultural richness and heritage documented in this digital encyclopedia

home.imageAlt: Sangkaning Dumadi Philosophy Illustration - Yogyakarta Philosophical Axis

footer.aboutDescription: A digital encyclopedia celebrating Javanese cultural and philosophical heritage along the Yogyakarta Philosophical Axis corridor.

kawasan.title: Philosophical Axis Area
kawasan.subtitle: More than just a geographical line, it represents a profound journey of human life - from birth to returning to the Creator, with each location and vegetation holding deep philosophical meaning

philosophy.title: The Philosophy of Sangkan Paraning Dumadi
philosophy.intro: As quoted from the official Kraton Jogja website, the Philosophical Axis stretches from Tugu Golong Gilig, Keraton, and Panggung Krapyak, depicting the journey of the human life cycle based on the concept of Sangkan Paraning Dumadi.

sangkan.title: Sangkan - Origin (Panggung Krapyak ‚Üí Keraton)
sangkan.description: The concept of Sangkan or origin, representing human maturation, is depicted through the journey from Panggung Krapyak to the Keraton.

panggung.title: üèõÔ∏è Panggung Krapyak - Birth
panggung.description: Panggung Krapyak symbolizes the beginning of birth or the womb. This is emphasized by the existence of a village to the northwest called Mijen, derived from the word "wiji" meaning seed.

road.title: üå≥ Road to Keraton - Youth
road.description: Asem (tamarind) and tanjung trees are planted along the road from Panggung Krapyak to the Keraton. Sinom (young tamarind leaves) symbolizes youth, and the tanjung tree represents young people who are always praised by their surroundings.

alunAlun.title: üå∫ South Square - Maturity
alunAlun.description: North of Panggung Krapyak is the South Square surrounded by pakel and kweni trees, symbolizing young adults who have reached maturity and have the courage to propose to their beloved.

sitiHinggil.title: üíë Siti Hinggil Kidul - Union
sitiHinggil.description: At Siti Hinggil Kidul, there are pelem cempora trees with white flowers symbolizing male seed, and soka trees with red flowers symbolizing female seed.

pamengkang.title: üö™ Pamengkang - Gateway of Life
pamengkang.description: To the left and right of Siti Hinggil Kidul are roads named Pamengkang, meaning legs positioned apart. It symbolizes the gateway to the womb. The Kamandhungan complex to its north represents the soul or fetus waiting to be born.

sangkan.conclusion: The Sangkan philosophy ends when the child has grown into an adult.

paran.title: Paran - Return to the Creator (Tugu ‚Üí Keraton)
paran.description: The concept of Paran, representing the human journey towards the Creator, is depicted from Tugu Golong Gilig to the Keraton.

tugu.title: ‚ö™ Tugu Golong Gilig - Purity
tugu.description: Tugu Golong Gilig symbolizes the unification of thought, feeling, and will to face the Creator. White color is chosen to symbolize purity of heart.

margatama.title: üõ£Ô∏è Jalan Margatama - Towards Excellence
margatama.description: South of Tugu Golong Gilig is Jalan Margatama, meaning "towards excellence".

margamulya.title: ‚ú® Jalan Margamulya - Towards Glory
margamulya.description: Jalan Margamulya means "road to glory". To reach it, humans must be able to expel bad desires.

pangurakan.title: üßò Jalan Pangurakan - Expelling Desires
pangurakan.description: The next road is named Jalan Pangurakan, symbolizing the process of expelling bad desires within humans.

vegetation.title: üåø Road Vegetation - Symbol of Peace
vegetation.description: Along Jalan Margatama to Jalan Margamulya, asam trees symbolize attraction and gayam trees symbolize peace. The meaning is that people will feel happy or attracted and calm or comfortable.

alunAlun.title: üåä Alun-Alun - Waves of Life
alunAlun.description: Alun-Alun is derived from the word "alun" (wave), depicting the various waves that humans face before returning to their Creator.

landmarks.title: Key Landmarks
landmarks.subtitle: Three main points forming the Yogyakarta Philosophical Axis

tugu.name: Tugu Pal Putih
tugu.description: Tugu Golong Gilig symbolizing the unity of thought, feeling, and will in Javanese philosophy

kraton.name: Kraton Ngayogyakarto Hadiningrat
kraton.description: Center of the Philosophical Axis, the Sultan's palace still functioning as the cultural heart of Yogyakarta

panggung.name: Panggung Krapyak
panggung.description: Southern point of the Philosophical Axis symbolizing the origin and destination of human life

unesco.title: World Cultural Heritage
unesco.description:
In 2023, the Yogyakarta Philosophical Axis was officially recognized by UNESCO as a World Cultural Heritage Site under the name "The Cosmological Axis of Yogyakarta and its Historic Landmarks".

This recognition affirms the outstanding universal value of an urban planning concept that integrates Javanese cosmology, traditional architecture, and life philosophy. The Philosophical Axis represents harmony between nature, humanity, and the Creator that has been preserved for centuries.

This corridor encompasses historic monuments from Tugu Pal Putih in the north to Panggung Krapyak in the south, with Yogyakarta Palace at its center, reflecting the spiritual journey of human life from birth to return to the Almighty.

wisata.title: Tourism Potential
wisata.subtitle: Explore amazing tourist destinations along the Philosophical Axis corridor - from legendary beaches to magnificent temples

section.title: Tourist Destinations
section.description: Discover the best tourist destinations along the Yogyakarta Philosophical Axis

map.title: Tourism Interactive Map
map.subtitle: Click markers on the map to view tourist location details and important information
map.notConfiguredDesc: Admin can set the map URL in the admin dashboard.

parangtritis.name: Parangtritis Beach
parangtritis.description: Legendary beach with spectacular sunsets, volcanic black sand, and Labuhan tradition. Perfect place to enjoy water sports and cultural tourism.

alunAlunKidul.name: South Square
alunAlunKidul.description: Open square with iconic twin banyan trees. Famous for "Masangin" tradition - walking blindfolded between two banyan trees. Bustling night culinary area.

kraton.name: Yogyakarta Palace
kraton.description: The Sultan's palace still in use today. Visit museums, watch dance and gamelan performances, and learn about magnificent traditional Javanese architecture.

malioboro.name: Malioboro Street
malioboro.description: The heart of Yogyakarta shopping tourism. Iconic street with batik, handicrafts, local cuisine, and street performances. An unforgettable shopping experience.

tugu.name: Yogyakarta Monument
tugu.description: Iconic monument that serves as the city's landmark. Symbol of Yogyakarta people's resistance. Beautiful public area for photos and relaxation.

bentengVredeburg.name: Fort Vredeburg Museum
bentengVredeburg.description: Historic fort now serving as a museum. Learn about Indonesia's independence struggle through dioramas and interactive exhibitions.

tamanSari.name: Taman Sari Water Castle
tamanSari.description: Former Sultan's water palace complex. Unique architecture blending Javanese and European styles. Bathing pools, underground tunnels, and the mysterious Sumur Gumuling.

prambanan.name: Prambanan Temple
prambanan.description: The largest Hindu temple complex in Indonesia. UNESCO World Heritage Site with stunning Ramayana reliefs. Ramayana Ballet performances every night.

kaliurang.name: Kaliurang
kaliurang.description: Cool mountain resort area on Mount Merapi's slopes. Fresh air, natural scenery, and various outdoor activities like hiking and camping.

bestTime.title: Best Time
bestTime.description: Visit during dry season (April-October) for optimal weather

photoSpots.title: Photo Spots
photoSpots.description: Each destination has charming Instagram-worthy photo spots

localCulture.title: Local Culture
localCulture.description: Respect local customs and traditions when visiting

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: All destinations easily accessible by public transport

cta.title: Plan Your Visit
cta.description: Need help planning your tourist trip? Contact us for more information and personal recommendations.

sejarah.title: History and Research of Yogyakarta's Philosophical Axis
sejarah.subtitle: Learn about the history and philosophy that shapes Yogyakarta's cultural identity

unesco.title: UNESCO Recognition as World Heritage
unesco.content: On September 18, 2023, the international community bestowed special recognition upon Yogyakarta's cultural wealth. During the World Heritage Committee meeting held in Saudi Arabia, the UN organization for education and culture designated the Yogyakarta Philosophical Axis with the official name "the Cosmological Axis of Yogyakarta and Its Historic Landmarks" as part of the world's cultural heritage.

universal.title: Universal Values Contained
universal.content: This designation was not without reason. The Yogyakarta Philosophical Axis was deemed to meet the strict criteria established for showcasing extraordinary intercultural dialogue. This area stands as living proof of how various belief systems, from animism, Hindu-Buddhism, Islam with Sufi influences, to touches of Western civilization, converge and form a unique cultural identity. According to officials from the DIY Cultural Office, this area holds universal significance, not only for the people of Yogyakarta or Indonesia, but for all of humanity.

philosophy.title: Deep Philosophy That Must Be Preserved
philosophy.content: The Governor of DIY emphasized that this Philosophical Axis is not merely a physical heritage in the form of buildings or urban spatial planning. Beyond that, this area is rich with profound philosophy that must be maintained along with all its attributes and meanings. The hope is that this international recognition can become a momentum for collective learning about the noble values needed to build a better future.

livingHeritage.title: Continuing Cultural Life
livingHeritage.content: What makes the Yogyakarta Philosophical Axis special is its existence as a living heritage. Not merely monuments of the past, this area remains the center of various Javanese traditions and cultural practices that continue to this day. From state ceremonies, implementation of customary law, art and literary performances, cultural festivals, to spiritual rituals, all are still conducted around this historic area.

responsibility.title: Shared Responsibility
responsibility.content: This UNESCO recognition is expected to inspire all parties, both in Yogyakarta and throughout Indonesia, to jointly preserve and maintain the cultural heritage we possess. This preservation is not only the responsibility of the government, but also of the entire community as heirs of this culture.

cta.title: Explore Further
cta.description: Discover more information about the Yogyakarta Philosophical Axis

tentang.title: About
tentang.subtitle: Digital encyclopedia of Yogyakarta Philosophical Axis cultural heritage

content.paragraph1: The Yogyakarta Philosophical Axis Encyclopedia is a digital platform dedicated to documenting, promoting, and preserving the rich cultural heritage along the Philosophical Axis corridor.
content.paragraph2: Our mission is to be a trusted source of information about the history, culture, and economic potential of the Philosophical Axis area, while supporting cultural heritage preservation and local community empowerment.
content.paragraph3: This platform is developed with a combination of traditional Javanese aesthetics and elegant modern interface, creating an educational and captivating digital experience.

cta.title: Join Us
cta.description: Let's work together to preserve and promote the cultural heritage of Yogyakarta's Philosophical Axis

section.title: MSME Catalog
section.description: Support local products from MSME entrepreneurs preserving Yogyakarta's traditional culture and crafts

batikWinotosastro.name: Batik Winotosastro
batikWinotosastro.description: Traditional hand-drawn batik artisan with classic Yogyakarta motifs. Provides high-quality stamped and hand-drawn batik with natural dyes.

wayangPakJoko.name: Wayang Kulit Pak Joko
wayangPakJoko.description: Handcrafted shadow puppets made by experienced craftsmen. Each puppet is meticulously carved with high artistic value.

gudegYuDjum.name: Gudeg Yu Djum
gudegYuDjum.description: Legendary authentic Yogyakarta gudeg with recipes passed down through generations. Sweet, savory, and tender flavors in every bite.

silverKotagede.name: Silver Kotagede
silverKotagede.description: Fine silver craftsmen from the historic Kotagede area. Creates jewelry and accessories with intricate details and guaranteed quality.

gerabahKasongan.name: Gerabah Kasongan
gerabahKasongan.description: Handcrafted ceramics from Kasongan Village, famous for creative ceramic products. Perfect for home decoration and souvenirs.

bakpiaPathok25.name: Bakpia Pathok 25
bakpiaPathok25.description: Legendary Bakpia Pathok with various flavors. The most popular souvenir from Yogyakarta with authentic taste and guaranteed quality.

lurikBuYanti.name: Lurik Bu Yanti
lurikBuYanti.description: Traditional Yogyakarta lurik fabric woven by hand. Features typical striped patterns with natural colors and high durability.

kulitManding.name: Kerajinan Kulit Manding
kulitManding.description: Quality leather crafts from Manding Village. Creates various leather products from bags to shoes with modern designs.

jamuAyuManis.name: Jamu Ayu Manis
jamuAyuManis.description: Traditional herbal remedies made from selected natural ingredients. Various formulations for health and beauty care.

blangkonPakDarmo.name: Blangkon Pak Darmo
blangkonPakDarmo.description: Traditional Javanese headgear handmade with various patterns and motifs. Perfect for traditional ceremonies and cultural performances.

keripikTempeBuHadi.name: Keripik Tempe Bu Hadi
keripikTempeBuHadi.description: Crispy tempe chips with savory and crunchy flavor. Made from quality soybeans and hygienic processing.

souvenirKayuJogja.name: Souvenir Kayu Jogja
souvenirKayuJogja.description: Wooden handicrafts with various unique and artistic designs. Perfect for souvenirs, gifts, and home decorations.
